text: Eric Dane, 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria' star, dies at 53 nearly 1 year after revealing ALS diagnosis - Yahoo

text: U.S. economic growth slowed sharply at the end of 2025, dragging down the year - The Washington Post
fullText: The U.S. economy experienced a slowdown in 2025, with the rate of GDP growth dropping because of tariffs and a government shutdown.

text: Trump gets his Board of Peace, even as bigger countries steer clear - Politico

text: Life is harsh and dangerous in Russian-run parts of Ukraine, activists and former residents say - AP News
fullText: Four years into its full-scale invasion, Russia controls about 20% of Ukrainian territory, where an estimated 3 million to 5 million people live. Life in shattered cities and villages alike remains difficult, with residents facing problems with housing, water…

text: How extreme cold is affecting Americans’ lives, according to a new AP-NORC poll - AP News
fullText: A new AP-NORC poll shows more Americans say extreme cold has affected their lives after frigid weather engulfed much of North America at the beginning of 2026. The survey found that 57% of U.S. adults report severe cold or winter storms in the past five years…

text: Bath & Body Works starts selling on Amazon as more brands embrace its logistics network - CNBC
fullText: Bath & Body Works CEO Daniel Heaf told CNBC the Amazon launch is about meeting customers where they are and leveraging Amazon's fast and free shipping.

text: Tracking flu cases in the US through maps and charts - CNN
fullText: The current flu season has seen the highest rate of doctor’s visits for flu-like symptoms since the US began collecting data through a national surveillance network. CNN is tracking these case rates and hospitalizations across the country.

text: Scientists worry about lasting damage from Potomac sewage spill - NPR
fullText: Drinking water around the District of Columbia hasn't been contaminated. But scientists say the environmental damage could be severe.

text: What worked and what didn't with a cellphone ban at a Kentucky school - NPR
fullText: Keeping students off their devices is the new norm in many schools. We talked to students and educators at one Kentucky school to see how it's working.

text: Trump says world has 10 days to see if Iran agrees deal or 'bad things happen' - BBC

text: U.S. fighter jets intercept Russian warplanes off Alaskan coast - CBS News
fullText: Two Russian Tu-95s bombers, two Su-35s fighter planes and an A-50 spy plane were detected in the Alaskan Air Defense Identification Zone, NORAD said.

text: Iran dangles investment proposals as off-ramp from Trump's gunboat diplomacy - CBS News
fullText: President Trump has one bright red line for Iran's nuclear program and some areas of flexibility as he weighs military strikes or a possible deal in the coming days.

text: Cavs pick up where they left off prior to the break, obliterate helpless Brooklyn Nets, 112-84 - Cleveland.com
fullText: The surging Cavs picked up where they left off more than a week ago, crushing the lottery-bound Brooklyn Nets, 112-84, on Thursday night inside Rocket Arena.

text: William Foege obituary: epidemiologist in smallpox success - The Times

text: Apple and Jon Prosser coordinating deposition in iOS 26 leak case - 9to5Mac

text: Governors group skips White House meeting after Trump refused to invite two Democrats - PBS
fullText: The National Governors Association is pulling out of an annual meeting at the White House after President Donald Trump declined to invite two Democratic governors, undercutting one of Washington's few remaining bipartisan gatherings.
